# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply ## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the SMES unit is anchored and operational. - Check that the wall-mounted substation unit is anchored and operational. - Check that each APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check each APC unit's current Load** (W).
## 1.2. S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit
- Check if the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is anchored to the floor. - Check if the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit has fuel. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation during flight. - Check if the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is set to HV output. - Set Target Power for 30 [bold]k[/bold]W. - Start the S.U.P.E.R.P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit. - Close radiation shielding.
## 2. Atmospherics ## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that the O2 canister is anchored to connector port. - Check that the N2 canister is anchored to connector port. - Check that the gas mixer is set to the correct mixing ratio (21% Oxygen, 79% Nitrogen). - Check that the gas mixer is set to 101.3kPa. - Check that the gas mixer is enabled. - Check that vents in each room are operational.
## 2.2. Waste Loops
- Check that scrubbers in each room are operational. - Set the Air Alarm in Reception to Filtering (Wide). - Set the Air Alarm in Medical to Filtering (Wide).
## 2.3. Cryo Loop
- Ensure that the CryoPod, gas pump, and freezer are anchored, powered, and disabled. - When enabling the CryoPod for use, first ensure the gas pump is enabled. Ensure that it is set to 101.3kPa. - After confirming the gas pump is enabled, enable the freezer. Wait a moment for the pod to get to temperature (140K by default). - Before use, verify that the CryoPod is at the appropriate pressure and temperature using a Gas Sensor. - (Optional) Enable the Gas Filter and verify its operational condition. Use this to filter respiration and any other unwanted gases from the network. - (Optional) When disabling machinery on the cryo loop, ensure the gas pump remains on, as the line will remain cold.
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled.
## Sidenotes
* - NanoTrasen Civilian typically designates their ships as service vessels. Facets of the Resolve's ship design -- particularly the open plan layout of medical and the chemistry lab -- identify it as a food service prototype repurposed for medical. NC complied with all appropriate permits and signoff with command prior to deployment.
** - Resolve-class vessels are equipped with two APC units split across the fore and aft (read: front and back) of the ship, located in Medical and Reception. In some cases, these ensure redundant power; the medbay doors benefit from this, for example.
